creator: spam@fluxus.lt
text:
well, i have situation:
VirtualDocumentRoot /web/%-2.1/%-2.%1/%-3+/virtual

for example www.other.name.com should be /web/n/name.com/www.other

where %-2.%1 is impossible situation - i have no way to put . between 'name' 
and 'com' and there is no option to specify 'the penultimate and all subsequent 
parts'

referring to http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/mod_vhost_alias.html

I don't know if this works in 1.3, but in the 2.0 documentation it says:

"If you want to include the . character in a VirtualDocumentRoot directive, but
it clashes with a % directive, you can work around the problem in the following way:

VirtualDocumentRoot /usr/local/apache/vhosts/%2.0.%3.0

And it is working in my setup (%-2.0.%-1/%-3)
